{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thromboprophylaxis refers to the prevention of blood clots. Low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) is a type of anticoagulant medication used for this purpose. It is typically administered via the subcutaneous route, as this allows for slow and steady absorption into the bloodstream. Intravenous administration would result in a rapid and potentially dangerous increase in anticoagulant effect. Inhalational and intramuscular routes are not typically used for LMWH administration.", "answer_choice": "A. Subcutaneous"}
